data.title: The incredibly fabulous life of Queen Sof√≠a of Spain
data.meta_description: Queen Sof√≠a has lived an exciting life. We rounded up a list of her accomplishments throughout her life as Queen consort of Spain.
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Queen Sof√≠a was born in November of 1938 and is now 80 years old.

Although originally from Greece, she came to power in Spain after marrying then-Prince Juan Carlos.

Queen Sof√≠a has had a fabulous life with her husband and three children, as well as the grandchildren she now has.

Queen Sof√≠a of Spain may not make big headlines like the British royals, but that doesn't mean her life is any less remarkable.

The now 80-year-old queen has lived quite the fabulous life. Although she is usually reserved when it comes to putting things out for the public to see, there have been many notable moments in her 56-years as queen and queen consort.

This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Queen Sof√≠a was born on November 2, 1938 in Athens, Greece. She is the daughter of King Paul of Greece and Frederica of Hanover

Queen Sofia turns 80 ! From Princess of Greece to Princess of Spain, from Princess of Spain to Queen of Spain , Sofia has always been a woman , a Queen immensely popular both in Greece and in Spain ! Without a ‚Äúfaux pas ‚Äú!, she is the remarkable and irreplaceable Queen of Spain #greekroyals #greekroyalfamily #greekroyalty #queensofia #princesssofiaofgreece #reinasofiadeespa√±a #reinasofia #familiareal

A post shared by Royal House of Greece (@royalhouseofgreece) on Nov 1, 2018 at 5:02pm PDTNov 1, 2018 at 5:02pm PDT

She has two siblings: King Constantine II and Princess Irene

During her childhood, she spent time living in both Egypt and South Africa, especially during the second World War

On this day, in 1978, Spanish Parliament approved the current Constitution. In the picture Queen Sofia with her husband King Juan Carlos and her son Prince Felipe in December of same year, when Spanish Constitution received also King‚Äôs approval üá™üá∏üëë . #greekroyals #greekroyalfamily #royalsofgreece #royals #royalfamily #instaroyals #familiareal #familiarealespa√±ola #spanishroyalfamily #spanishroyalfamily #queensofia #reinasofia #kingfelipevi #constitucionespa√±ola

A post shared by @ royalsofgreece on Oct 31, 2018 at 4:52am PDTOct 31, 2018 at 4:52am PDT

After her preliminary education, she studied childcare, music, and archaeology. She also attended Cambridge.

Sofia, Queen of Spain üá™üá∏, Princess of Greece üá¨üá∑ and Denmark üá©üá∞ turns 80 tomorrow, a remarkable woman an unique irreplaceable Queen. #greekroyals #greekroyalty #greekroyalfamily #queensofia #queensofiaofspain#reinasofia

A post shared by Royal House of Greece (@royalhouseofgreece) on Nov 1, 2018 at 12:48am PDTNov 1, 2018 at 12:48am PDT

In 1960, Queen Sof√≠a represented her home country of Greece as a reserve member of the Gold Medal-winning sailing team at the Summer Olympics

She married Juan Carlos of Spain on May 14, 1962.

The two married in Athens though, after marrying Juan Carlos, Queen Sof√≠a gave up her right to the Greek throne in order to serve Spain. Soon after, in 1973, the monarchy in Greece was dismantled. Their wedding was comprised of three ceremonies: a Catholic one, a Greek Orthodox one, and a civil union.

Advertisement

On December 20, 1963, the year after they got married, the couple welcomed their first child, Elena, into the world

Less than two years later in June of 1965, Queen Sof√≠a gave birth to her second daughter, Cristina. In January of 1968, the couple welcomed their third and final child, Felipe, into the family.

In May of 1977, she started the Queen Sof√≠a Foundation, which picks various causes to support, such as Alzheimer's research, women in business, and social welfare.

She has also worked alongside UNICEF many times, advocating for them and their cause.

She became the queen consort in June 2014 when her husband stepped down as king in favor of their son, Felipe.
